title: Ticket #5439: Add event timestamp to dagman.out and jobstate.log
description:
Karan (from Pegasus) wants the dagman.out file and jobstate.log file to show the actual time an event was logged, not just the time that DAGMan saw the event. So a format something like this: 

  12/02/15 16:45:35 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for HTCondor Node NODERET (136.0.0 (12/02/15 16:45:32)

(Event timestamp in parens at the end.)
remarks:
2015-Dec-13 15:29:36 by wenger:
This should be pretty easy to actually implement, but I think it will probably break some tests that look for specific lines in the dagman.out file...

2015-Dec-13 15:32:30 by zmiller:
Looks like there's a parenthesis missing in: 
(136.0.0 (12/02/15 16:45:32)

2015-Dec-14 14:42:12 by wenger:
Created V8_5-gittrac_5439-branch for this.

2015-Dec-14 15:11:04 by wenger:
Hmm -- another question is whether we need to/want to change dagman.out, or just jobstate.log.

Currently, the jobstate.log lines look like this: 

  1450126747 NodeB SUBMIT 257.0 viz - 2

So I'm thinking to change the format to this: 

  1450126747 NodeB SUBMIT 257.0 viz - 2 [1450126745]

I guess the alternative would be something like: 

  1450126747 [1450126745] NodeB SUBMIT 257.0 viz - 2

but I figure that's more likely to break existing code that's reading this.

2015-Dec-14 15:25:40 by wenger:
Hmm -- looking at the code, it looks like the event timestamps in the jobstate.log file are from the event itself, not from DAGMan, so we may be able to just leave that alone.

2015-Dec-14 15:27:01 by wenger:
Ah, I need to document the timestamps in the jobstate.log section of the DAGMan manual chapter.

2015-Dec-16 11:58:31 by wenger:
I decided to go with curly braces for the event timestamp, like this: 

  12/15/15 14:26:52 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for HTCondor Node NODERET (359.0.0) {12/15 14:26:52}

since we don't have anything else in curly braces in those lines, so it should be easier to parse.

2016-Jan-06 15:08:08 by wenger:
Kind of a scary thing that I noticed when working on this: the ULogEvent class has both a time_t and a struct tm. I don't know why we have both. But the really scary thing is that (when reading events, at least) (in DAGMan) they don't always correspond to the same time. Most of the time they do, but sometimes they're a few seconds off...

2016-Jan-11 13:20:35 by wenger:
Hmm -- should some of the fixes to the event timestamps go into 8.4??

2016-Jan-11 13:22:53 by zmiller:
Regarding putting changes in 8.4.X: What happens if the timestamps don't match? Does it impact the behavior, or cause DAGs to get stuck or anything? Or is it just a matter of logging incorrect informatioin?

2016-Jan-14 13:59:44 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Suggestions:
  1. The new timestamp put in curly braces is meant to be parsed by pegasus, and as such should not be subject to the D_TIMESTAMP debug system flag and should always be printed in the same format.
  2. In condor_dagman/debug.cpp:time_to_str(), the code here can be rewritten to both do the above and simplify the code.

2016-Jan-14 15:30:50 by wenger:
Dealt with minor issues from the code review; I'm merging this to master.
